measured_by: Resting-State Functional Connectivity (rsFC) measured by EEG
justification: The study focuses on MDD and uses resting-state functional connectivity (rsFC) via EEG to analyze how MDD affects brain networks, providing insights into the intrinsic connectivity of the brain during rest.

PDC and ffPDC were used to identify EEG biomarkers for MDD by assessing the temporal synchronization of neural activity across brain areas, yielding the best classification results with F1-scores up to 0.790.
Increased rsFC in the alpha frequency band, as measured by EEG, was found to be associated with depressive symptoms, particularly in frontal and posterior brain regions.
